manifesto.headline: The Gold Rush Is Over
manifesto.subheadline: Don't Let the "Jeans Sellers" Win This Time.
manifesto.body1: In every gold rush, the ones who made the real fortune were those selling shovels and jeans, not the miners.
manifesto.body2: Internet, E-commerce, Marketing Automation... history repeats itself. Now, the AI "Big Wednesday" is here ‚Äî a wave 30 meters high.
manifesto.body3: But if selling "AI prompts" or "training courses" has become the "essence" of AI ‚Äî isn't that missing the point entirely?
manifesto.highlight: The most effective and correct way to use AI lies within your daily relationships with your customers, family, colleagues, and bosses.
manifesto.conclusion1: AI is not a magic wand. AI is not a teacher giving you the answers.
manifesto.conclusion2: AI is a partner that takes over the drudgery, creates time, and organizes your thoughts so you can connect more deeply with the people who matter.
manifesto.conclusion3: Your years of experience and judgment, honed in the field ‚Äî that is the ultimate weapon when combined with AI.
manifesto.finalMessage: Our goal is to use AI to reclaim our human work and life.

problem.sectionTitle: The Problem No One Talks About
problem.quote: I once asked an internal assistant to summarize a document I had permission to access. It declined due to policy restrictions. That moment revealed something important: when AI appears "blocked," the issue is often not the model ‚Äî it's the way knowledge is governed and structured.
problem.insight: The AI wasn't broken. It was underfed ‚Äî missing the structure it needed.

concept.sectionTitle: The Idea of an Enterprise OS
concept.subtitle: An Enterprise OS is a shared knowledge layer that keeps track of changes and connects people, systems, and AI.

layer1.title: Infrastructure

faq.sectionTitle: Making It Real: Three Questions You're Probably Asking

q1.question: How do existing systems connect?
q1.answer: Your systems stay exactly as they are. Enterprise OS just connects them. GitHub Actions syncs data through REST APIs. ERP, CRM, SharePoint ‚Äî mature connectors already exist for all of them. No custom middleware required. Existing review tools integrate through webhooks and PR status checks.

q2.question: What about security?
q2.answer: Protected by the same infrastructure that secures the world's most critical software.
points: Enterprise Cloud with data residency options
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC)
Advanced Security (GHAS) with automatic secret scanning
SOC2 Type II / ISO 27001 / FedRAMP

q3.question: What does it look like for users?

gettingStarted.subtitle: You don't have to boil the ocean. Start with one workflow.

steps.title: Pick One Pain Point
steps.description: Find the workflow where knowledge fragmentation hurts the most. Content localization, customer support, regulatory compliance ‚Äî choose the one people complain about every day.

steps.title: Build a PoC on GitHub
steps.description: Move that workflow's documents into a GitHub repository. Set up version control, branch for regional variants, and enable PR-based approval. Show that it works.

steps.title: Add the AI Layer
steps.description: Connect an AI assistant to read from the repository. Now the AI has context, history, and structure. Watch it go from "generic" to genuinely useful.

steps.title: Expand Organically
steps.description: Success drives adoption. Once one team sees results, others will ask to join. Each connected workflow makes the platform smarter.

reasons.title: The AI Gap Is Widening
reasons.description: 88% of organizations use AI, but only 39% see measurable impact (McKinsey, Nov 2025). The difference isn't the AI ‚Äî it's the data foundation. Companies that fix this first will pull ahead for good.

reasons.title: Knowledge Is Walking Out the Door
reasons.description: In the U.S., Baby Boomers are retiring at 10,000+ per day. Every departure without knowledge capture is permanent loss. Enterprise OS makes knowledge transfer part of daily workflows ‚Äî not a side project.

reasons.title: The Technology Is Ready
reasons.description: Git, GitHub Enterprise, AI APIs ‚Äî everything needed already exists. The missing piece isn't technology. It's the vision to connect what's already there.
